channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket booster landing impacts the commercial spaceflight market
item.description: Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket successfully made its way to orbit for the second time on Nov. 13, 2025. Although the second launch is never as flashy ...

item.title: This Cisco exec started at the $306 billion company 30 years ago after interviewing for the wrong gig. It inspired her to fight for entry-level jobs
item.description: Fran Katsoudas, Cisco’s chief people, policy, and purpose officer, started her three-decade career at the digital communications giant after experienc...

item.title: ‘A parent’s worst nightmare’: Lawsuits pile up against ByHeart baby formula startup after wave of infant illnesses
item.description: Last week, the baby nutrition company ByHeart recalled all of its infant formula over concerns that it may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum ...

item.title: What Sofia and Roman Coppola’s mother taught them about creativity
item.description: Being the children of Francis Ford Coppola had a profound impact on the filmmaking sensibilities of Sofia and Roman Coppola. But their mother, Eleanor...

item.title: GLP-1 price war heats up as Novo Nordisk offers $199 starter doses
item.description: Novo Nordisk, the Danish drug company that makes Ozempic and Wegovy, is now offering the drugs at lower prices for self-pay patients. On Monday, the c...

item.title: MacKenzie Scott Once Borrowed $1,000 From Her College Roommate—It Made an Unexpected Impact
item.description: Scott has donated billions since her divorce from Jeff Bezos.

item.title: Your Employees’ Health Insurance is in Jeopardy. Here’s What to Do About It
item.description: The government shutdown is over, but tax credits that cut health care coverage costs for small-business employees are still in danger.

item.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei Just Made a Surprising Call for AI Regulation
item.description: On ’60 Minutes,’ Amodei also made a sweeping prediction about how AI will have a ‘significant job impact’ on one sector.

item.title: Why you can only find the new Starbucks holiday drink at Target
item.description: Looking for some holiday cheer? Customers who want to try Starbucks’s new holiday treat, the Frozen Peppermint Hot Chocolate drink, will have to go to...

item.title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ Just Nailed the Problem With AI Products
item.description: The skit is a joke—but the problem with AI errors is all too real. The bit is worth a watch.

item.title: Companies need to take a human-centric approach to AI, experts say, as executives try to shift from experimentation to implementation
item.description: “For every dollar that we spend on technology, we should spend three more on people," said Gastón Carrión, Accenture's APAC lead of talent.

item.title: ‘In 2030, he’s not going to be the president’: Even Republicans are warning of Trump’s lame duck status as affordability, Epstein threaten to derail tenure
item.description: "You will have voted to protect pedophiles if you don’t vote to release these files, and the president can’t protect you then," Rep. Thomas Massie tol...

item.title: FTC data confirms job offer text scams are 4 times more common now and have cost job seekers almost $300 million
item.description: Text scams have grown especially quickly in the last five years, with 20,673 reports last year compared with just 4,872 reports in 2020.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani hopeful of meeting with Donald Trump soon to talk about affordability
item.description: “The president ran a campaign where he spoke about a promise to deliver cheaper groceries, a promise to reduce the cost of living," the mayor-elect sa...

item.title: Why Employers Still Cover GLP-1 Drugs as Prices Skyrocket
item.description: Recent studies show the surging popularity of Ozempic, Wegovy, and similar drugs for weight loss is driving employer health coverage costs higher.
